NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco, Nokia: Huawei a ‘Growing Challenge,’ Say Raymond James, UBS
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Telecom analysts are reflecting on the annual report yesterday by Chinese telecom equipment and smartphone vendor Huawei, which is privately held.
Huawei’s annual report is available in PDF form on its Web site.
Huawei saw sales growth of 8.6% in 2013, up from 7.9% in 2012, to $39.5 billion.
The company remarked that “Huawei earned 65% of its revenue from markets outside of

NewsDetails.TitleText: LaSalle Solutions Wins Cisco Services US Partner of the Year Award at Cisco Partner Summit 2014
NewsDetails.ContentText:
ROSEMONT, IL--(Marketwired - Apr 1, 2014) - LaSalle Solutions , a leading provider of life-cycle management services for technology and capital assets, announced today that it is the recipient of the Cisco® Services Partner of the Year for the United States. Cisco unveiled the award winners at a global awards reception during its annual partner conference this week in Las Vegas.

NewsDetails.TitleText: New Linksys partner program, products announced at Interop
NewsDetails.ContentText: Small business-focused networking vendor Belkin , which last year acquired the Linksys brand and engineering assets from Cisco , and then began to roll out new Linksys-branded products, is making a flurry of announcements at Interop today to strengthen the Linksys business. These included a new line of six Smart Switches, two new 802.11ac Access Points, and a new consolidated partner

NewsDetails.ContentText:

Looking at the equity, the company’s one day range is $22.30 to $22.80 and has

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco expands security solutions with open platform, analytics
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Summary: The company’s security ecosystem will integrate with Cisco Internet of Things products, with the goal of providing developers a common platform to deliver solutions for public safety, utilities and industrial environments.
Cisco will expand its safety and security lineup with new open platform applications and analytics, the company announced Tuesday. The company's security

NewsDetails.TitleText: Tech Data Expands Cisco Services Practice With SMARTattach Opportunity Portal
NewsDetails.ContentText: CLEARWATER, Fla., April 1, 2014 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Tech Data Corporation (Nasdaq: TECD ) today introduced the SMARTattach Opportunity Portal, designed to help solution providers maximize recurring revenue and unattached opportunities on service contract renewals of Cisco® products sold throughout the United States, Canada, and Latin America. shortly after introducing first switches, VPN routers and IP surveillance products

NewsDetails.TitleText: HP Set to Deliver on SDN Vision
NewsDetails.ContentText:
HP announces availability of SDN security product originally known as Sentinel and new cloud managed Wi-Fi capabilities.
LAS VEGAS. HP is now delivering a part of its previously announced SDN networking solution and expanding cloud management for Wi-Fi access points.
The new HP Cloud Managed Network Wireless LAN solution will enable enterprises to manage their wireless

NewsDetails.TitleText: Linksys rolls out SMB-focused routers and switches
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Linksys has launched new products geared towards businesses, unveiling two new dual-band wireless-AC access points and six new switches.
Announcing the new products at the Interop show in Las Vegas, Linksys showed off two new 802.11 ac access points, which are designed for network administrators, resellers, and small to mid-sized businesses (SMBs).
As an upgrade to older wireless-G or?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems rival Arista Networks for IPO
NewsDetails.ContentText: Arista Networks is known for making network switches for large data centers. The company has filed for an IPO today and has listed Morgan Stanley and Citigroup as the lead underwriters for the offering. Arista could potentially raise $200 million from the IPO. Arista Networks is led by former Cisco executive Jayashree Ullal. Some of the companies customers include Facebook,

NewsDetails.TitleText: HP enters the cloud-managed WiFi fray
NewsDetails.ContentText:
HP has jumped into the cloud -managed WiFi offering, announcing at Interop in Las Vegas that it will bring its own Cloud Managed Network products by the middle of the year.
Cloud managed WiFi has been championed by companies like Meraki , which was purchased by Cisco in late 2012, and promises easier and more central management of a wireless network via a cloud-based interface, making

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco challenger Arista files for IPO; S-1 shows strong growth, profits
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Arista Networks, a maker of low-latency/high-density Ethernet switches aiming to upend Cisco's (CSCO +0.8%) dominant data center market position, has filed for a $200M IPO under the symbol ANET. Morgan Stanley and Citi are the lead underwriters.
Arista's S-1 reveals the company had 2013 revenue of $361.2M (+87% Y/Y), and net income of $20.8M. Analysts previously estimated Arista's

NewsDetails.TitleText: Multimedios Redes Chooses Cisco DOCSIS Solution for Its Network
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco announced today that MULTIMEDIOS REDES, a leading Mexican company offering triple play services - telephony, Internet and video - in the northern states of Nuevo Leon, Coahuila and Tamaulipas, has chosen the Cisco® DOCSISâ 3.0 solution. DOCSIS 3.0 next-generation cable access network is one of the key components of the Cisco IP Next Generation Network (IP NGN).

NewsDetails.TitleText: Mission alignment drives biggest deal of the year
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco’s $2.7 billion acquisition of Sourcefire last October was driven in large part by a new paradigm in cyber security, a threat-centric approach that addresses the full attack continuum across ever-extending networks.
What Sourcefire brought to Cisco was the technology, talent and innovation to bolster its portfolio of security products and services under the new model, Cisco

NewsDetails.TitleText: New routers offer productivity boost for SMBs
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Networking equipment vendor Linksys used the Interop conference in Las Vegas to expand its business networking lineup with two new 802.11ac access points.
The new offerings are aimed at business looking to upgrade their existing wireless infrastructure to the latest 802.11ac technology, and according to Linksys they offer up to three times faster speeds for connected devices over the

NewsDetails.TitleText: This Woman Left Cisco To Lead A Powerful Startup And Is About To Have Her Pay Day
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Arista Networks, a company in the networking industry that just filed paperwork for an IPO , is worth watching.
Arista was founded in 2005 and has been gaining momentum since 2008, when it lured away one of Cisco's top engineers, Jayshree Ullal, to be its CEO. Prior to Arista, Ullal ran Cisco's bread-and-butter routing, switching business, leading it to $10 billion in annual revenue.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems focus of Russian bribery probe
NewsDetails.ContentText:
SAN JOSE -- Computer networking and communication giant Cisco Systems is at the center of a probe involving allegations that some of its workers bribed Russian officials to bolster its sales in that country.
In a story Sunday about the allegations, online news site BuzzFeed said the San Jose corporation is being investigated by the U. S. Justice Department and U.S. Securities and

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Volunteers Helping to Feed the Hungry
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Little known to most people, including residents of Houston, Texas, there is a peanut butter cannery here. The cannery is operated by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and is capable of producing over 1 million jars of peanut butter a year.
Thanks to the coordination efforts of Terry Edge, a Cisco Channels Manager, two teams of Cisco employee volunteers produced 12,595

NewsDetails.TitleText: Arista Networks files for IPO, ups the ante against Cisco
NewsDetails.ContentText: Arista Networks, a Santa Clara-based maker of programmable Ethernet switches on a mission to dethrone Cisco, has finally filed the paperwork for its long-anticipated IPO. The firm did not disclose the number of shares to be sold or an expected price, and didn’t provide a date, but revealed that it’s looking to raise $200 million. Morgan Stanley and Citigroup are leading the

NewsDetails.TitleText: Linksys Unveils a Pair of Dual-Band 802.11ac Access Points
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Wireless routers are all well and good, but they don't exactly have a very great range, especially when it comes to covering a whole floor in a business building. So wireless access points are needed sometimes, like the ones Linksys has just released.
Called LAPAC1200 and LAPAC1750, they both support 802.11ac technology and communicate over both the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands.
The

NewsDetails.TitleText: New Linksys dual-band Wireless-AC Access Points released
NewsDetails.ContentText: Linksys expanded its business networking line-up with two new 802.11ac access points which allow network administrators, resellers and businesses to deploy a high-speed wireless network or upgrade their existing wireless infrastructure to the latest 802.11ac technology.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco to Follow the Open Road in Building Out its Intercloud
NewsDetails.ContentText: In late March, Cisco Systems announced that it plans to invest more than $1 billion to expand its cloud business in the next two years, including building an OpenStack-based Intercloud , described as a "network of clouds," with several partners. The Cisco global Intercloud is being built for the Internet of Everything, with real-time analytics, “near infinite” scalability and full

NewsDetails.TitleText: Mobily, Cisco enter into joint marketing, sales agreement
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco and Mobily, the official brand name of Etihad Etisalat and a leading mobile and data service provider in Saudi Arabia, announced Sunday that they have signed a joint marketing and sales agreement following a Memorandum of Understanding signed by both companies, on Sept. 17, 2013, to strategically collaborate and streamlines Cisco and Mobily's competitive resources creating a joint?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Announces Platinum Sponsorship for COMEX Oman 2014
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco announced today its sponsorship for the 5th annual COMEX Oman Forum, the Sultanate’s leading ICT Show, where it will return to showcase ICT innovation around the theme of “Tomorrow Starts Here”. Cisco will serve as Platinum Sponsor for COMEX 2014 which runs this year from 7th -11th April 2014 at the Oman International Exhibition Centre.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco’s partner organization chief looks to build is own legacy
NewsDetails.ContentText:
LAS VEGAS - Bruce Klein , senior vice president of Cisco’s Worldwide Partner Organization, follows in the footsteps of Keith Goodwin and before him Paul Mountford .
Mountford was the executive along with Cisco channel chief Edison Peres who crafted one of the most progressive channel strategies in the IT industry: the Value Incentive Program VIP. This program is currently in its 22nd

NewsDetails.TitleText: There's no bubble in business Wi-Fi, Aerohive CEO says
NewsDetails.ContentText:
David Flynn sees a growing need for dense Wi-Fi networks with cloud-based management
IDG News Service - Aerohive Networks sells not just enterprise Wi-Fi gear but also cloud-based software designed to make it easier to set up and manage a customer's entire wired and wireless network. Other wireless LAN vendors are moving in the same direction, including Cisco Systems, the biggest seller

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco, IBM Launch Internet of Things Consortium | NewsFactor Business
NewsDetails.ContentText:
The Internet of Things has made plenty of headlines lately, but this one is huge: Cisco, IBM, GE and AT&T have formed the Industrial Internet Consortium, aiming to break down proprietary barriers.
Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's vision of bringing Internet to remote areas involves satellites, lasers and drones. He just bought a firm pioneering in solar-powered unmanned craft to

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO): Patent Infringement Suit by Patent Troll Spherix
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Tomahawk, WI 03/28/2014 (Basicsmedia) – Technology companies have been fighting the menace of ‘patent trolls’ in recent years. Now, it’s Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO)’s turn.
The neutral term for patent trolls is ‘non practicing entities.’ The modus operandi of these NPEs can amount to a form of extortion where they seek fat licensing fees from operating companies for patents the

NewsDetails.TitleText: Spherix Targets Cisco with Patent Infringement Allegations
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Spherix, which acquired several Nortel patents in December 2013, is taking legal action against Cisco Systems, alleging Cisco is infringing on 11 patents currently owned by Spherix.
In the midst of its Partner Summit, Cisco Systems (CSCO) is finding itself the target of a patent infringement lawsuit stemming from one of the many companies that acquired the assets of Nortel Networks . ?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Launches Its Cloud Business With a Bold Strategic Shift to Services
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco's plan to deliver a Cisco Powered cloud platform and services that will be available from multiple partners puts the IT world on notice that it will now become a cloud services provider as well as an equipment supplier.
On 24 March 2014, Cisco announced it will become a service provider through a global public cloud strategy, and that it will partner with service providers and its

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco, IBM Launch Internet of Things Consortium
NewsDetails.ContentText:
The Industrial Internet Consortium's goal is to deliver best practices, reference architectures, case studies and standards requirements to ease deployment of connected technologies for the Internet of Things. The open-membership group also plans to influence the global standards development process for Internet and industrial systems.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco aims for more managed, professional services revenue for partners
NewsDetails.ContentText: LAS VEGAS -- Selling Cisco services has been big business for the vendor and upward of 90% of its partners -- to the tune of $2.5 billion in revenue from Smart Services technical support alone. Moving up from these foundation services to the broader portfolio of Smart Services , such as Cloud Discovery Services, Connected Mobile Experience, Data Virtualization and Collaboration Services,

NewsDetails.TitleText: AT&T, Cisco, GE, IBM and Intel form consortium for IoT
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Five major players in telecom and industry are joining forces to accelerate interoperability in the development of the Internet of Things through industrial Internet applications.
AT&T, Cisco, GE, IBM and Intel have formed the Industrial Internet Consortium (IIC) , which is an open membership, not-for-profit group that plans to “take the lead in establishing interoperability across

We got the chance to catch up with partners to hear their perspectives on today’s General Session. Here’s what they had to

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco to build billion dollar ‘Intercloud’ with Telstra a key partner
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco says it and its partners will build a global network of clouds, the next phase in cloud computing and a key enabler of the Internet of Everything.
It will build the ‘Intercloud’ – a network of clouds – together with a set of partners, including Telstra. It will cost over US$1 billion.
Cisco says the global Intercloud is being architected for the Internet of Everything, with

NewsDetails.TitleText: With Intercloud, Cisco Ends Role as Arms Dealer (Redmond Channel Partner | Blogs)
NewsDetails.ContentText: When it comes to cloud, Cisco just shifted from acting as an "arms dealer" to becoming a cloud services provider in its own right, according to analysts at Technology Business Research (TBR).

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco, IBM and Intel aim for Industry Internet of Things adoption through new non-profit
NewsDetails.ContentText:
A new non-profit has been launched that is working towards boosting the fortunes of the industrial Internet of Things [IoT] sector.
The Industry Internet Consortium [IIC], launched by AT&T, Cisco, GE, IBM and Intel, has a mandate to improve integration between physical and digital worlds, and it’s hoped the adoption of industrial Internet applications will help to hasten the IoT

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Pushes Nexus Switch Bandwidth Higher
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco advanced its case for converging the management of the data center operations around its servers and switches with the announcement this week of a new high-end series of switches that support 10/40G Ethernet aggregation today and 40/100G aggregations tomorrow.
Announced at the Cisco Partner 2014 Summit , Todd Brannon, director of product marketing for unified computing at Cisco,

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Supplied Network Infrastructure During Nuclear Security Summit in The Hague
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco supplied the network infrastructure for the Nuclear Security Summit 2014 (NSS), held in The Hague on 24 and 25 March. Cisco was awarded the contract by SSC-ICT Haaglanden after submitting a tender that offered the best combination of price and quality.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems, Inc. (CSCO) Sued By Spherix
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Spherix Inc ( NASDAQ:SPEX ), an intellectual property company, filed a lawsuit against computer networking giant, Cisco Systems, Inc. ( NASDAQ:CSCO ) for allegedly infringing on 11 patents it acquired from Nortel Networks Corporation (OTCMKTS:NRTLQ) in December last year.
According to Spherix Inc ( NASDAQ:SPEX ), the patent infringement accounts for the majority of the $43 billion

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco upgrades partner programme
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco is transforming its existing channel partner and services programme into new Cisco Partner Ecosystem to better support partners on their way to cloud and help them benefit from market opportunities, it says.
The upgraded Cisco Partner Ecosystem strives to win a broader set of partners, in particular ISVs, consulting firms, technology and Internet of Things partners, it says.

NewsDetails.ContentText: CLEARWATER, Fla., March 27, 2014 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Tech Data Corporation (Nasdaq:TECD) today announced that it received two Cisco® Partner Summit awards for Global Distributor of the Year and U.S. Distributor of the Year. The awards were presented at the 2014 Cisco Partner Summit held this week at the Venetian Resort Hotel Casino in Las Vegas, Nev. Tech Data was recognized by Cisco for

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco patches six security flaws that posed DoS cyber attack risk
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco has plugged six flaws in its Internetwork Operating System (IOS) Software that could theoretically be exploited by hackers to launch cyber attacks on its customers.
Cisco released the fixes in its IOS Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication. The update features five fixes for its IOS Software and a single patch for its Cisco 7600 Series Route Switch Processor 720 with 10

NewsDetails.TitleText: Spherix sues Cisco over switches, routers patent infringement
NewsDetails.ContentText:
March 27 (Reuters) - Spherix Inc, which buys and licenses technology patents, said it filed a lawsuit against Cisco Inc alleging infringement of 11 patents Spherix acquired from Nortel Networks.
Spherix said the infringement accounted for a "vast majority" of Cisco's more than $43 billion in sales of routers and switches in the United States over the five years ended July 27, 2013.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Spherix (SPEX) Sues Cisco (CSCO) Over Alleged Patent Infringement
NewsDetails.ContentText: Spherix Incorporated (Nasdaq: SPEX ) announced that it has commenced patent litigation in the United States District Court for the District of Delaware against Cisco Incorporated (Nasdaq: CSCO ) alleging that the San Jose, CA based company infringes 11 patents owned by Spherix. These patents, developed by inventors at Nortel Networks and acquired by Spherix in December 2013, relate to

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco makes $1B bet on the cloud
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco is making a bold bet to become a larger player in the burgeoning cloud market with plans to invest $1 billion to build what it calls a global Intercloud--a network of clouds.
Working with service provider and network infrastructure partners such as Allstream and Telstra (ASX: TLS.AX), which will provide data center and other related assets, the vendor said its Cisco Cloud Services

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO): NSA Proof Cloud Computing
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Boston, MA 03/26/2014 (wallstreetpr) - The new $1 billion investment in cloud computing disclosed by Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) is part of the response by corporate America and companies around the world to secure their data in the face of the spying activities of the NSA. The need for data security has created opportunities that Cisco wants to leverage.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco pushes partners towards enterprise mobility at Partner Summit
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco announced a number of enhancements to its mobility business at Partner Summit 2014 in Las Vegas on Wednesday, as it continues its attempt to push the channel towards software, the Internet of Everything , and the need to address the Line of Business (LOB) buyers increasingly bypassing IT departments and CIOs.

NewsDetails.ContentText:
Jason Nash comments on his blog: Today Cisco announced that they were investing $1B over the next two years to expand their “Cisco Powered” cloud initiative. NewsDetails.ContentText: jfruh (300774) writes "The venerable Nortel Networks may have vanished into bankruptcy five years ago, but thanks to U.S. patent law, it can strike back at its old rival Cisco from beyond the grave. NewsDetails.TitleText: Live Blog: Cisco Launches Enterprise Mobility App Platform

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Unveils Partner Program Update at Partner Summit
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco Systems announced updates to its channel partner program at Cisco Partner Summit 2014 in Las Vegas. The networking company unveiled changes to its certifications, specializations and incentives.
The Cisco Systems Channel Partner Program is evolving again to further enable and reward partners for adopting and bringing to market new networking consumption models and seeking out

NewsDetails.ContentText:
The Internet of Things -- which Cisco dubs the Internet of Everything -- generates lots of noise. But can it generate money?
Can the Internet of Things -- which Cisco calls The Internet of Everything -- generate profit and revenue growth for channel partners and service providers? Cisco Partner Summit 2014 offered some hype -- and clues.

Together with strategic partners and service providers, Cisco global Intercloud is being architected for the Internet of Everything.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems Inc To Invest In Cloud Computing
NewsDetails.ContentText:
A pledge of $1 billion was made by Cisco Systems Inc in the next two years as the company indicated that it aims to join the market currently dominated by Amazon.com Inc. The company will use the amount in creating data centers that will facilitate the operation of Cisco Cloud Services news service.
The company aims to make the most of the desire of companies is renting computing

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Says Cloud Initiative Not a Direct Play
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco Systems Inc. is to invest $1 billion in pursuit of becoming the world’s leading hybrid cloud player, including the construction of “the world’s largest intercloud.” The vendor will be selling its enlarged Cisco Cloud Services portfolio directly, but has asserted that “the vast majority” of sales will still go through partners, and denies its cloud plans represent a “covert direct?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco’s Cloud and Managed Service Provider Channel- It all Becomes Clear Now
NewsDetails.ContentText:

Cisco executives have been attending MSPWorld and MSPAlliance events for the last few years, talking to MSPs about the future of cloud and the role

NewsDetails.TitleText: With DaaS Certification, Netelligent Achieves Trifecta
NewsDetails.ContentText:
NETELLIGENT Corporation, a technology solutions company, announced today that it has achieved the Cisco Powered Desktop as a Service (DaaS) Certification. This completes its third Cisco Powered Cloud Services designation, as Netelligent has already earned Cisco Powered Private Cloud (IaaS) and Cisco Powered Hosted Collaboration Solution (HCS) designations.

(TSI) , a leading integrator and provider of unified communications (UC) solutions, announced that it has achieved the Cisco TelePresence Certification.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Next Govt must usher ‘predictability’, generate investments in India: Cisco CEO
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Technology major Cisco expects to more than double revenues from India within the next 5 years even as it hopes that the next Government will usher in more ‘predictability’ in the country.
The $49-billion company wants India revenues to account for five per cent of overall revenues from less than two per cent currently, John Chambers, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, said.

which was invented by Nortel - following an agreement with the Rockstar consortium that bought the patents from the bankrupt Canadian company.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Plans to Build a Giant Cloud Network, But Why on OpenStack
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco's decision to build an intercloud for its channel partners and resellers on the OpenStack open source framework is a good idea since it will allow resellers to build out their own cloud networks at minimal cost.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco's Cloud Bet: What's in It for SPs?
NewsDetails.ContentText: Service providers struggling to implement a cloud strategy can look to a buddy for help. Cisco wants to be that buddy. Cisco this week introduced Intercloud, a strategy to enter partnerships with service providers to go to market together with cloud services for the enterprise. Cisco plans to invest $1 billion over the next two years on infrastructure to implement Intercloud. ?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Cloud Services emerge: Let the 'coopetition' begin
NewsDetails.ContentText: With Cisco Cloud Services, the networking giant is transforming from hardware vendor to service provider and will sometimes compete with its partners.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Say good-bye to the Cisco silver partner
NewsDetails.ContentText:
LAS VEGAS – In the midst of introducing Cisco’s next generation channel partner program, Edison Peres, the senior vice president of channels for the San Jose, Calif.-based company dropped a bombshell at the Partner Summit conference. Cisco is retiring the silver tier on April 1st, 2016.

NewsDetails.TitleText: UXC bags Cisco ANZ Partner Award
NewsDetails.ContentText:
UXC Limited has been awarded Teaming Excellence Award of the Year 2013 at the Cisco Australia and New Zealand Partner Insight Awards.
“Cisco ANZ’s Partner Insight Awards celebrate the high achievers within our partner community,” says Jason Brouwers, director of the Partner Business Group for Cisco ANZ.
“UXC Limited is a truly deserving winner of Teaming Excellence Award of the Year

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco pushes into 'cloud' with $1 bil investment
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco Systems announced plans Monday to invest $1 billion to step up its cloud computing with several global partners.
The California-based equipment maker said the alliance would build “the world’s largest global Intercloud,” or a network of clouds to support objects ranging from wearable devices to appliances to automobiles.

NewsDetails.TitleText: The hardest conversation you have had
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Anthony Perridge, EMEA channel director at Sourcefire, now a part of Cisco, talks about information security attitudes and practices, and why employees with the highest access to valuable company information are more likely to engage in risky behaviours.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco joins cloud computing race with $ 1 b plan
NewsDetails.ContentText:
REUTERS: Cisco Systems Inc plans to offer cloud computing services, pledging to spend $ 1 billion over the next two years to enter a market currently led by the world’s biggest online retailer Amazon.com Inc, the Wall Street Journal reported.
Cisco said it will spend the amount to build data centres to help run the new service called Cisco Cloud Services, the Journal reported.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco's Cloud Plan For Internet Of Things
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco's $1 billion cloud investment is not about competing with Amazon, Google, or Rackspace to supply general-purpose IaaS. Cisco and its partners will offer a global chain of datacenters to serve as a backbone for the Internet of Things.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) Rides High On Cloud Based Offerings
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Tomahawk, WI 03/25/2014 (Basicsmedia) – San Jose based US IT giant Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) recently unveiled an ambitious plan to erect world’s largest global Intercloud in association with several other well reputed partners.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Partners Watching Cisco's New Intercloud 'Very Closely'
NewsDetails.ContentText: As the world’s largest maker of networking equipment, Cisco previously positioned itself as the preferred supplier of architectural building blocks for cloud builders. NewsDetails.TitleText: Accudata Systems Achieves Cisco Master Security Specialization in USA
NewsDetails.ContentText:
HOUSTON, March 25, 2014 /PRNewswire/ -- Accudata Systems announced today that it has achieved the Cisco® Master Security Specialization. This specialization recognizes Accudata as having fulfilled the training requirements and program prerequisites to sell, deploy, and support highly sophisticated Cisco network security solutions.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Introducing the Next Generation Cisco Channel Partner Program
NewsDetails.ContentText: The Cisco Channel Partner Program has always focused on value versus volume, rewarding partners who create value, no matter their size or sales volume. The program has evolved over time to identify market transitions, enable our partners through these transitions and recognize partners for their practices. NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco's SourceFire buy gives tech giant renewed network security momentum
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco's $2.7 billion purchase of Sourcefire last fall has enabled the tech giant to regain momentum in the growing network security market, according to data from Infonetics Research.
Through the acquisition, Cisco increased its market revenue by 20 percent in the fourth quarter, its highest security revenue quarter ever, says Jeff Wilson, principal analyst for security at?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Pledges $1B for Supercharged ‘Intercloud’
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Networking giant Cisco today announced a two-year plan to invest $1 billion in the expansion of its cloud infrastructure.
Working with partners, Cisco said it will build a network of clouds – dubbed the Intercloud – which will be used, in part, to support the Internet of Everything.

NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco Systems plans to invest over $1 billion to expand its cloud presence over the next two years. This includes building an OpenStack-based “network of clouds” with partners. Clearly Cisco plans to take aim at the success of AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and the hope is to provide a very late impact in the market.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco Plans $1 Billion Investment In Cloud Computing To Compete With Amazon
NewsDetails.ContentText:
It's often said you have to spend money to make money, and if that's true, Cisco may make a fortune in the cloud space. That's because the networking guru is reportedly planning to invest a king's ransom -- $1 billion, to be precise -- over the course of the next two years building data centers that will help run a new service it's calling Cisco Cloud Services.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco's big about-face on cloud services
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Three years ago as part of a comprehensive cloud strategy, Cisco pledged to address every aspect of cloud except services – it did not want to compete with customers.

NewsDetails.TitleText: New Cisco switches take aim at big data centers, data applications
NewsDetails.ContentText: Cisco this week is unveiling two new configurations of its recently-launched Nexus 9000 switches , a new 40G Nexus switch. In addition, Cisco is celebrating the fifth anniversary of its UCS server. Cisco also announced certification programs for its new Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) programmable networking product line, which includes the Nexus 9000 switches.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco to Invest $1B in its Global Cloud Network; Robert Lloyd Comments
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Cisco will spend more than $1 billion during the next two years to expand its cloud computing business and deliver enterprise cloud services through a global partner ecosystem.
The Intercloud network will offer a suite of analytics, security and data sovereignty architectures to support the Internet of Everything, Cisco said Monday .

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco to invest $1 billion to expand cloud business
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Networking giant Cisco will invest USD one billion (about Rs 6,200 crore) over the next two years to expand its cloud business and build a “network of clouds” with partners to take on rivals like IBM and Amazon.
Cisco intends to build the world’s largest global “Intercloud” or a network of clouds to capitalise on the growing trend of companies opting for services rather than buying and?

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco will throw $1bn at the cloud
NewsDetails.ContentText:
CISCO HAS ANNOUNCED plans to invest $1bn in expanding its cloud computing business to help it compete with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and VMware.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Cisco to invest over $1B in cloud computing
NewsDetails.ContentText:
NEW YORK (AP) -- Cisco says it plans to spend more than $1 billion over the next two years to build up its cloud computing network.
Cisco plans to use the money to expand its data centers for the new service to be called Cisco Cloud Services.

NewsDetails.ContentText: Technology major Cisco will expand its partnership with Wipro as part of its $1-billion push into the burgeoning cloud computing space over the next two years. The company plans to build what it says will be the world’s largest network of ‘clouds’ along with nine partners, including the Bangalore-based software services company.
